com.mindfusion.scheduling

Class MonthRangeSettings

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mindfusion.scheduling.ViewSettings
      • com.mindfusion.scheduling.MonthRangeSettings

  • public final class MonthRangeSettings
extends ViewSettings
    Defines settings for the years in the calendar.

      • getMonthsPerRow

        public java.lang.Integer getMonthsPerRow()
        Description copied from class: MonthRangeSettings
        Gets the number of months to be displayed in a row.

        If this value multiplied by MonthRangeSettings.getVisibleRows() is larger than MonthRangeSettings.getNumberOfMonths(), the calendar component displays scrollbars letting users scroll the view up and down.

        Returns:
        An integer value specifying how many months are displayed in a row in the month range view. The allowed values range from 1 to 12.

      • setMonthsPerRow

        public void setMonthsPerRow(java.lang.Integer value)
        Description copied from class: MonthRangeSettings
        Sets the number of months to be displayed in a row.

        If this value multiplied by MonthRangeSettings.getVisibleRows() is larger than MonthRangeSettings.getNumberOfMonths(), the calendar component displays scrollbars letting users scroll the view up and down.

        Parameters:
        value - An integer value specifying how many months are displayed in a row in the month range view. The allowed values range from 1 to 12. Set to null to use the corresponding value from the current theme.

      • getVisibleRows

        public java.lang.Integer getVisibleRows()
        Description copied from class: MonthRangeSettings

        Returns:

      • getNumberOfMonths

        public java.lang.Integer getNumberOfMonths()
        Description copied from class: MonthRangeSettings
        Gets the number of months to display in the MonthRange view.

        If the number of months is larger than number of rows multiplied by MonthRangeSettings.getMonthsPerRow(), the calendar component displays scrollbar, letting users scroll the view up and down.

        Returns:
        A positive integer value specifying how many months to display in the view.

      • getHeaderHeight

        public java.lang.Integer getHeaderHeight()
        Description copied from class: MonthRangeSettings
        Gets the height of the header in a MonthRange view.

        A value of 0 causes the calendar control to automatically calculate the header height based on the size of the header font.

        Returns:
        A non-negative integer value specifying the height of the header in pixels.

      • setHeaderHeight

        Parameters:

        Description copied from class: MonthRangeSettings

        value - A string specifying the display format. Set to null to use the corresponding value from the current theme.

      • getTitleSeparator

        public java.lang.String getTitleSeparator()
        Description copied from class: MonthRangeSettings
        Gets the string used as a title separator in a MonthRange view that displays more than 1 month at a time.

        The format of the text displayed in the view's header is in the format "<FirstDate><TitleSeparator><LastDate>", where <FirstDate> and <LastDate> indicate the first and the last visible dates in the calendar, formatted according to MonthRangeSettings.getTitleFormat(). The <TitleSeparator> represents the value of this property. If MonthRangeSettings.getTitleSeparator() is an empty string, then the header's text is only "<FirstDate>".

        Returns:
        A string containing the separator text.

      • setTitleSeparator

        public void setTitleSeparator(java.lang.String value)
        Description copied from class: MonthRangeSettings
        Sets the string used as a title separator in a MonthRange view that displays more than 1 month at a time.

        The format of the text displayed in the view's header is in the format "<FirstDate><TitleSeparator><LastDate>", where <FirstDate> and <LastDate> indicate the first and the last visible dates in the calendar, formatted according to MonthRangeSettings.getTitleFormat(). The <TitleSeparator> represents the value of this property. If MonthRangeSettings.getTitleSeparator() is an empty string, then the header's text is only "<FirstDate>".

        Parameters:
        value - A string containing the separator text. Set to null to use the corresponding value from the current theme.

        Description copied from class: MonthRangeSettings
        Gets the offset of the shadows from the headers that cast them.
        Returns:
